meanings.sent1: After eating too much candy, he felt sick and had to ralph.
meanings.sent2: The baby ralphed all over the floor after drinking too quickly.
meanings.sent3: Don't eat that expired yogurt unless you want to ralph!
meanings.sent4: The turbulent boat ride made him feel like he was going to ralph overboard.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the garbage made her ralph uncontrollably.

meanings.sent1: Ralph is coming over for dinner tonight.
meanings.sent3: Ralph always brings a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: When Ralph walks into the room, it lights up.
meanings.sent5: I have a friend named Ralph who loves to fish.
